evidence.text: the Motion is GRANTED, and the Consent Decree is PROVISIONALLY ENTERED; and it is further ORDERED that the Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree is scheduled to be held on ________________, 2025 at __________________; and it is further ORDERED that all case management deadlines are stayed pending the Court’s determination, at or after the Fairness Hearing on the Terms of the Consent Decree, whether to enter the Consent Decree as a Final Order.

extracted.value: The court granted the Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree, provisionally entering the Consent Decree and scheduling a Fairness Hearing, with case management deadlines stayed pending final determination.

evidence.text: ORDER granting 10 Motion to Stay is GRANTED and that all case management deadlines, including the United States' deadline to serve the Summons and Complaint on the City of Durham, are stayed pending the courts resolution of the Parties' Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree.

extracted.value: The court granted the Motion to Stay Case Management Deadlines, staying all deadlines including service of Summons and Complaint pending resolution of the Consent Decree motion.

evidence.text: ORDER signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 01/15/2025, that the motion (Doc. 13 ) is GRANTED. The word limit for the briefing the court requested regarding the applicability of Ricci v. DeStefano, 557 U.S. 557 (2009), (Minute Entry Dec. 16, 2014), is increased to 9,000 words.

extracted.value: The court granted the Motion to Exceed Word Limit, increasing the word limit for briefing on the applicability of Ricci v. Destefano to 9,000 words.

evidence.text: ORDER that the motion 14 is GRANTED in that American Alliance for Equal Rights is granted leave to file its brief as amicus curiae as a separate document forthwith. The court reserves decision on whether the Alliance shall be granted leave to present argument at any future hearing. See L.R. 7.5(f).

extracted.value: The court granted the Motion for Leave to File Amicus Brief, allowing the American Alliance for Equal Rights to file its brief as amicus curiae as a separate document, with reservation on argument at future hearing.

evidence.text: Plaintiff United States of America hereby dismisses the above-captioned case pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 41(a)(1).

extracted.value: The court dismissed the case pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 41(a)(1), as the plaintiff voluntarily dismissed the action without the defendant having filed an answer or motion for summary judgment, making the dismissal self-executing and effective upon filing.
